Barcelona boss Ernesto Valverde admits his side were "rolled over" and "blown away" by Liverpool in their Champions League semi-final second leg 4-0 defeat.

Divock Origi's two goals either side of a double from Georginio Wijnaldum sealed Liverpool a memorable 4-0 win, putting them through to the Madrid final 4-3 on aggregate as Barcelona were left reeling.

Only four times in the tournament's history has a side overturned a first-leg deficit of three goals or more to progress from a knockout tie.

"They have been really strong, they played really well and they kind of us rolled us over, really," admitted Valverde.

"It is a terrible result for our fans and for ourselves but credit is due to Liverpool.

"You're going to suffer, the fans will suffer as well. That's what it is like. We didn't expect a situation like this.

"You have to go through this penitence and we've not got long to go until the end of the league season.

"We've got the cup still to fight for and we've got to really finish the season well on a high after this.

"But at the moment we're blown away, it's terrible."

Former Liverpool forward Luis Suarez echoed Valverde's words, saying the team are in pain, and that the fourth goal scored by Origi from a quickly-taken Trent Alexander-Arnold corner was defended "like schoolboys."

"We have to be ready for all the criticism that is going to rain down on us now. We are very sad, we are in a lot of pain."

Suarez, who was jeered by Liverpool fans, added: "For their fourth goal we looked like schoolboys."

replies.msg:
https://www.theguardian.com/football/2019/may/08/lionel-messi-tears-barcelona-liverpool-anfield?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

Lionel Messi broke down in tears in Barcelona’s Anfield dressing room

• Argentinian inconsolable after semi-final defeat to Liverpool
• Messi then missed team bus to airport due to drug testing

Lionel Messi broke down in tears after his dream of winning the Champions League for a fifth time with Barcelona collapsed against Liverpool.

The Argentina international was inconsolable in the Barcelona dressing room following the 4-0 defeat at Anfield, where the Spanish champions were on the receiving end of an incredible comeback in Europe for the second season running, having won the first leg 3-0 at the Camp Nou. Last season in the quarter-finals Barça beat Roma 4-1 at home but collapsed in the away leg to lose 3-0 in Rome and go out on away goals.

‘Shame. There is no other adjective’ – Spanish press on Barcelona’s defeat

Messi was then selected for a drugs test by anti-doping officials and the team coach departed for Liverpool John Lennon Airport without him as a consequence.

Reports in the Spanish media have claimed that, on his eventual arrival at the airport, Messi was involved in an angry confrontation with a group of Barcelona supporters furious at their team’s latest collapse in the Champions League.

Luis Suárez apologised for the manner of Barcelona’s exit and insists the players are ready to face the criticism heading their way. “We are very sad, hurt,” he said. “We are human beings, we feel the pain, the frustration. We have to put our chest out for the bullets that will come now.

“It cannot be that in a minute we concede two goals. [For] the fourth goal we looked like youngsters. We have to understand all the criticism that is going to rain on us.”

Barcelona’s president, Josep Bartomeu, described the defeat as a “disastrous night” for the club and the manager, Ernesto Valverde, accepted questions would be asked of his future following another European failure.

https://www.theguardian.com/football/2019/may/08/lionel-messi-tears-barcelona-liverpool-anfield?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

Lionel Messi broke down in tears in Barcelona’s Anfield dressing room

• Argentinian inconsolable after semi-final defeat to Liverpool
• Messi then missed team bus to airport due to drug testing

Lionel Messi broke down in tears after his dream of winning the Champions League for a fifth time with Barcelona collapsed against Liverpool.

The Argentina international was inconsolable in the Barcelona dressing room following the 4-0 defeat at Anfield, where the Spanish champions were on the receiving end of an incredible comeback in Europe for the second season running, having won the first leg 3-0 at the Camp Nou. Last season in the quarter-finals Barça beat Roma 4-1 at home but collapsed in the away leg to lose 3-0 in Rome and go out on away goals.

‘Shame. There is no other adjective’ – Spanish press on Barcelona’s defeat

Messi was then selected for a drugs test by anti-doping officials and the team coach departed for Liverpool John Lennon Airport without him as a consequence.

Reports in the Spanish media have claimed that, on his eventual arrival at the airport, Messi was involved in an angry confrontation with a group of Barcelona supporters furious at their team’s latest collapse in the Champions League.

Luis Suárez apologised for the manner of Barcelona’s exit and insists the players are ready to face the criticism heading their way. “We are very sad, hurt,” he said. “We are human beings, we feel the pain, the frustration. We have to put our chest out for the bullets that will come now.

“It cannot be that in a minute we concede two goals. [For] the fourth goal we looked like youngsters. We have to understand all the criticism that is going to rain on us.”

Barcelona’s president, Josep Bartomeu, described the defeat as a “disastrous night” for the club and the manager, Ernesto Valverde, accepted questions would be asked of his future following another European failure.

replies.msg:
Rafael Hernández

There’s no hiding or running away from this. I will enjoy the UCL final. Valverde can go to hell, he won’t ruin my enjoyment.

I’ve thought things through, not facing this absolute farce masterminded by Valverde and the conservative cowards at the Barcelona board would be a betrayal of everything the club once represented.

Rakitic less than a day after the shitshow at Anfield, goes out to a festival to have fun. No dignity, no commitment, no effort. Compare that to how the Liverpool players reacted after the 3:0 at the Camp Nou, and you will know exactly why Barcelona were knocked out.

Rakitic has become an entitled brat, he has done NOTHING to earn another renewal he’s demanding from Barcelona. Should’ve been sold to PSG for €125m last summer, what a missed opportunity that was.

Coutinho needs to be shown the door. No more chances, no more nothing. He’s the worst signing in the club’s history, the last curse Neymar managed to bring to Barcelona even without being there after years of lobbying.

It’s painful to know Frenkie De Jong and possibly Matthijs De Ligt joining Barcelona this summer might be considered a step down compared to how Ajax have been playing. Imagine going from this to “I’m too scared to win” Valverde? Good Lord.

A few Barcelona fans criticised Messi at the airport yesterday, the same man that has been dragging the club to trophies without stop ever since Guardiola left the club.

Messi was crying without stop in the dressing room after the match. He is the one player that shown he cares time and time again. When he leaves, the club will have nothing, then the idiots at the airport will understand.

He dragged Barcelona for the entire Champions League campaign, then you see a few fans attacking him because he didn’t run enough? He supposed to be Usain Bolt or a footballer?! It’s like they have never even watched Messi, it’s how he plays and wins.

Messi was the only reason Barcelona had a chance vs Liverpool coming to Anfield. He secured Barcelona a place in the final all by himself in the first leg! Valverde is a coward and the rest of his teammates hid behind him.

Barça will try to cover this failure with signings this summer. We're likely to see Griezmann and De Ligt signed.

The most important members in Barça's board think Valverde should be sacked. [Cadena SER]
